results.title: Reduction in infarct size, arrhythmias and chest pain by early intravenous beta blockade in suspected acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: In @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with ECG changes indicative of @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarction@@@ at entry, i.v. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ significantly reduced enzyme release by one-third and enhanced R-wave preservation.

citations.NLM: Yusuf S, Sleight P, Rossi P, Ramsdale D, Peto R, Furze L, Sterry H, Pearson M, Motwani R, Parish S, Gray R, Bennett D, Bray C. Reduction in infarct size, arrhythmias and chest pain by early intravenous beta blockade in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Circulation. 1983 Jun;67(6 Pt 2):I32-41. PMID: 6851037
citations.BibTeX: @article{6851037, title={Reduction in infarct size, arrhythmias and chest pain by early intravenous beta blockade in suspected acute myocardial infarction.}, author={Yusuf S and Sleight P and Rossi P and Ramsdale D and Peto R and Furze L and Sterry H and Pearson M and Motwani R and Parish S and Gray R and Bennett D and Bray C}, journal={Circulation}, volume={67}, number={6 Pt 2}, pages={I32-41}}

results.title: Effect of atenolol on treadmill performance in patients with angina pectoris.
results.text_hl: Antianginal efficacy was assessed by monitoring changes in treadmill exercise performance in each @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ 3 and 24 hours after the administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. The endpoint of the treadmill exercise was mild but definite @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@.

citations.NLM: Kritzer G, Warr TA, Strong ML, Froelicher VF. Effect of atenolol on treadmill performance in patients with angina pectoris. Clin Pharm. 1983 May-Jun;2(3):236-42. PMID: 6349909
citations.BibTeX: @article{6349909, title={Effect of atenolol on treadmill performance in patients with angina pectoris.}, author={Kritzer G and Warr TA and Strong ML and Froelicher VF}, journal={Clin Pharm}, volume={2}, number={3}, pages={236-42}}

results.title: Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by early intravenous atenolol in suspected acute myocardial infarction.
results.text_hl: The effect of intravenous @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on @DISEASE_Arrhythmias_Cardiac @DISEASE_MESH:D001145 @@@ventricular arrhythmias@@@ in @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@acute myocardial infarction@@@ was assessed in 182 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ admitted within 12 hours of the onset of @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@.

citations.NLM: Rossi PR, Yusuf S, Ramsdale D, Furze L, Sleight P. Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by early intravenous atenolol in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Br Med J (Clin Res Ed). 1983 Feb 12;286(6364):506-10. PMID: 6186329
citations.BibTeX: @article{6186329, title={Reduction of ventricular arrhythmias by early intravenous atenolol in suspected acute myocardial infarction.}, author={Rossi PR and Yusuf S and Ramsdale D and Furze L and Sleight P}, journal={Br Med J (Clin Res Ed)}, volume={286}, number={6364}, pages={506-10}}

results.title: Early intravenous atenolol treatment in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Preliminary report of a randomised trial.
results.text_hl: 214 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were studied in a randomised trial to determine whether administraiton of intravenous @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ within 12 hours of @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ reduced eventual @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ size, as estimated by cumulative enzyme release and by ECG changes. 135 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ already had ECG evidence of @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarction@@@ at entry; 72 received @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ which significantly decreased subsequent enzyme release (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and control means = 121 IU, SE +/- 10 and 177 IU, SE +/- 17; 2p < 0.005) and enhanced R-wave preservation (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and control means = 46% +/- 3 and 36% +/- 3; 2p < 0.02). 79 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ had no evidence of @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarction@@@ at entry; 44 did not receive @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and 27 of these subsequently developed @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarction@@@, whereas only 11 of 35 treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarcted@@@ during their hospital stay (2p < 0.01).

citations.NLM: Yusuf S, Ramsdale D, Peto R, Furse L, Bennett D, Bray C, Sleight P. Early intravenous atenolol treatment in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Preliminary report of a randomised trial. Lancet. 1980 Aug 9;2(8189):273-6. PMID: 6105436
citations.BibTeX: @article{6105436, title={Early intravenous atenolol treatment in suspected acute myocardial infarction. Preliminary report of a randomised trial.}, author={Yusuf S and Ramsdale D and Peto R and Furse L and Bennett D and Bray C and Sleight P}, journal={Lancet}, volume={2}, number={8189}, pages={273-6}}

results.title: Atenolol versus amlodipine versus isosorbide-5-mononitrate on anginal symptoms in syndrome X.
results.text_hl: Only @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was found to significantly improve @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ episodes, suggesting that it should be the preferred drug when starting pharmacologic treatment of @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@syndrome X

citations.NLM: Lanza GA, Colonna G, Pasceri V, Maseri A. Atenolol versus amlodipine versus isosorbide-5-mononitrate on anginal symptoms in syndrome X. Am J Cardiol. 1999 Oct 1;84(7):854-6, A8. PMID: 10513787
citations.BibTeX: @article{10513787, title={Atenolol versus amlodipine versus isosorbide-5-mononitrate on anginal symptoms in syndrome X.}, author={Lanza GA and Colonna G and Pasceri V and Maseri A}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={84}, number={7}, pages={854-6, A8}}

results.title: Atypical chest pain: coronary, aortic, and pulmonary vasculature enhancement at biphasic single-injection 64-section CT angiography.
results.text_hl: MATERIALS AND METHODS: With internal review board approval and HIPAA compliance, 50 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (16 @SPECIES_9606 @@@men@@@, 34 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@; mean age, 51.5 years; range, 30-75 years) with atypical @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ were referred from the emergency department and were imaged with a 64-section CT scanner after premedication with oral @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and/or intravenous @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Vrachliotis TG, Bis KG, Haidary A, Kosuri R, Balasubramaniam M, Gallagher M, Raff G, Ross M, O'neil B, O'neill W. Atypical chest pain: coronary, aortic, and pulmonary vasculature enhancement at biphasic single-injection 64-section CT angiography. Radiology. 2007 May;243(2):368-76. PMID: 17400761

results.title: Attenuation of exercise induced ST elevation in non-obstructive coronary disease--a case for calcium channel blockade?
results.text_hl: A male smoker already on @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ therapy, presented with @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ and dramatic exercise induced ST segment elevation.

citations.NLM: Petrie CJ, Oldroyd KG. Attenuation of exercise induced ST elevation in non-obstructive coronary disease--a case for calcium channel blockade? QJM. 2010 Dec;103(12):991-2. PMID: 20430754

results.title: [Multiple coronary fistulas to the left ventricle. An unusual cause of myocardial ischemia].
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, but not @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@, did ameliorate the symptoms.

results.title: Differential effects of selective beta-adrenergic blockade on insulin sensitivity and release in control subjects and in patients with angina and normal coronary arteries (syndrome X).
results.text_hl: The aim of the study was to evaluate the effects of short-term treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Carbohydrates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002241 @@@carbohydrate@@@ metabolism in @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@syndrome X@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@, as compared to normal subjects.

citations.NLM: Fragasso G, Cattaneo N, Locatelli M, Caumo A, Pagnotta P, Piatti P, Bonini P, Chierchia SL. results.title: Cardioversion of a supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) in a 7-year-old using a postural modification of the Valsalva manoeuvre.
results.text_hl: He had been suffering episodes of @DISEASE_Heart_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@palpitations@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Chest_Pain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002637 @@@chest pain@@@ for over a year and had been prescribed @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 25 mg ON, though the side effects meant he had not taken it for a month prior to presentation.

citations.NLM: Morley-Smith EJ, Gagg J, Appelboam A. Cardioversion of a supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) in a 7-year-old using a postural modification of the Valsalva manoeuvre. BMJ Case Rep. 2017 May 4;2017():. PMID: 28473422
